intro: Melicope ridsdalei, commonly known as the Ridsdale's melicope, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom throughout the year. It typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
